results.title: The Mole and the rocket
results.brief_description: An animated puppet film about the adventures of a young mole who finds a toy rocket which transports him to an island. Once on the island he meets creatures of the sea which help him to rebuild his rocket.

group_works.title: The Depths of space: exterior galaxies
The Milky way
group_works.creator_credit: Ruroy Sibley and I S O

results.title: The Milky way
results.creator_credit: Ruroy Sibley and I S O
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Universe”.
The stars and constellations of the Milky Way are shown by astronomical photography through the great telescope at Palomar Observatory, Mount Wilson, Harvard College, University of Colorado and the Yerkes Lowell and Lich Observatories. Various types of star clusters and nebular are included and the development of Nova Aquilae 1918 to 1932 is traced.

results.title: The Milgram re-enactment
results.brief_description: This docudrama re-enactment of psychologist Stanley Milgram’s case studies on “Obedience to Authority” was commissioned by the Centre for Contemporary Art, Glasgow and took place on 15th and 17th February 2002. The original controversial experiments took place at Yale from 1961-1962 and involved the “experimenter”, a “teacher” and a “learner” to investigate the effects of punishment on learning - the punishment consisting of a series of shocks for wrong answers with the voltage increasing by 15 increments with each wrong answer, beginning at 15 volts up to a maximum of 450 volts. However instead of the “learner”, it is actually the “teacher” who is the guinea pig and who is being studied to see just how far a subject will continue to administer pain whilst following orders. A very interesting study that makes the viewer experience various emotions from distress, frustration and even anger at the way humans can behave in certain situations. Cast: Graeme Edler (Experimenter), Charles Donelly (Leaner).

results.title: The Mick Fleetwood story: Two sticks and a drum
results.creator_credit: Jason Wright, Richard Journo and Creatvty
results.brief_description: Informative and reasonably honest account of the life of Mick Fleetwood, drummer and leader of the legendary rock band Fleetwood Mac. Utilising stills, archival footage and a slew of interviews both with Fleetwood and his contemporaries, this work elucidates the incredible immoderation of a successful rock musician’s life. Drink, drugs, women, limousines, jet planes, extensive travelling parties, money — in short, excess of just about everything that is a feature of the lifestyle. Fleetwood admits the drugs were nearly his undoing as well as the (well documented) shifting relationships in the band and the claustrophobic environment of relentless touring and recording. Interviewees include: Lindsay Buckingham, Stevie Nicks and Christine McVie.

results.title: The Meadow ant
results.brief_description: Explains where the meadow ants are found, and traces the lifecycle of the meadow ant: the nest-making, feeding, and mating. The film then describes the structure, classifies the different types of ant and deals comprehensively with their highly organised communities.
results.description: Explains where the meadow ants are found, and traces the lifecycle of the meadow ant: the nest-making, feeding, and mating. The film then describes the structure, classifies the different types of ant and deals comprehensively with their highly organised communities.
